item.title: Linux For Hackers
item.description:
Why is Linux good for ethical hackers?

The concept of Linux for ethical hackers focuses on the use of the Linux operating system for the sole purpose of ethical hacking. There are a couple of skills that hackers must equip themselves with as they approach hacking using Linux, because a good number of devices that they will be hacking into will be Linux devices and a large percentage of tools in existence today are Linux-based.

item.title: Series Part 1
item.description: In this first part of the series we’ll show you how to create a series

item.title: The Figure Shortcode
item.description: Hugo has figure shortcode built-in, so you can easily add figure captions or hyperlink rel attributes to images. Documentations can be found here:

item.title: Go For Hacking Part 2
item.description: In this second part of the series we’ll show you where to find the full series

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: Guide to Thumbnails in Hugo
item.description: Thumbnails can be enabled easily by setting the thumbnail parameter in the frontmatter to an image such as "images/landscape.jpg". Make sure to copy the image the static/images/ directory.

item.title: About
item.description: Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content.
